The water cycle is the continuous movement of water through Earth's systems. Water evaporates from oceans and lakes, forms clouds, falls as precipitation (rain/snow), and flows back to water bodies through rivers and groundwater.

Magnets work due to the alignment of electrons in certain materials. These aligned electrons create magnetic fields with north and south poles. Opposite poles attract each other while like poles repel, and the magnetic field extends invisibly around the magnet.
